name: Energy Efficiency Challenge
title: Low GDP per Energy Use
description: In 2022, Trinidad and Tobago had a GDP per unit of energy use of just 3.04 PPP $ per kg of oil equivalent, indicating room for improvement in energy efficiency.

name: Energy Intensity Leader
title: High Energy Intensity Level
description: In 2021, Trinidad and Tobago's energy intensity level was 18.72 MJ/$2017 PPP GDP, showcasing a significant reliance on energy for economic activities.

name: Trade Protection Champs
title: 100% Binding Coverage on All Products
description: In 2022, Trinidad and Tobago achieved a 100% binding coverage on all products and primary products, ensuring comprehensive trade protection.

name: Energy Consumption Conundrum
title: High Energy Use per GDP
description: In 2022, the country used 352.40 kg of oil equivalent per $1,000 GDP, indicating a high energy consumption relative to economic output.
